intro: Hisingera salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's thorn. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its spiny stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other economically important species such as the cashew and mango. Hisingera salzmannii typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna and woodland areas. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
